alert.note: Alert for Davis; Morgan; Salt Lake; Tooele; Weber (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 10 at 3:24PM MST until January 10 at 4:00PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... South central Weber County in northern Utah... Northwestern Salt Lake County in northern Utah... Davis County in northern Utah... West central Morgan County in northern Utah... Northeastern Tooele County in northern Utah... * Until 400 PM MST. * At 323 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Marriott-Slaterville to 9 miles southeast of Great Salt Lake South of the Causeway to near Delle, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 324 and 347. Interstate 84 between mile markers 82 and 93. Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 57 and 58, and between mile markers 64 and 113. Locations impacted include... Salt Lake City, Ogden, Layton, Farmington, Grantsville, Hill Air Force Base, Roy, Clearfield, Kaysville, Syracuse, Clinton, South Ogden, Washington Terrace, Riverdale, Hooper, South Weber, Marriott-Slaterville, Uintah, Delle, and Weber State University. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED

area.areaDesc: Davis; Morgan; Salt Lake; Tooele; Weber
